Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2012 01:36PM nancym712 wrote: Thanks for all of your comments, advice, and reassurances.  My uncle remembers that one of his aunts died from some cancer but doesn't know what it was. I had BCRA testing, my insurance paid for it so why not, BCRA1 is negative, and BCRA2 is undetermined which my oncologist says makes it negative.   Thanks again, I feel a bit better about not having all this old medical history. Nancy
Posts.Title: Grandmother's medical records nancym712 leaf

Posts.Content: nancym712 wrote: I was diagnosed Nov 2011 with BC.  My mother refused to have a mammogram because she didn't want the exposure to radiation.  She died 3 years ago from the complications of Hepatitis at age 78 but as far I know she had no bc.  My maternal grandmother on the other hand had a double mastectomy and I don't know how many years later died of some "female" cancer.  Those things weren't talked about in the 50s so even my mother didn't know what her mother's cancer was.  Is it important for me to know and if so, how do I go about getting medical records for someone who died in 1955 before I was born?  She probably died in New Bedford, MA but I don't know what hospital.  My mother has a cousin who is in her late 80s who I can ask for info but I doubt she knows any more than my mother did.  Suggestions?  NancyM Dx 11/20/2011, IDC, Right, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Grandmother's medical records nancym712 leaf
